publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-1506# David Mundell: Robert Burns—That the Parliament recognises the immeasurable contribution which the life and works of Robert Burns have made to the history and culture of Scotland; commends the activities of the Robert Burns World Federation, individual Burns’ Clubs and the many other organisations and individuals who are dedicated to preserving and promoting Burns’ memory and work in Scotland and abroad, and believes that the Scottish Executive should do all it can to ensure that the maximum educational, cultural and economic, particularly from tourism, benefits are gained by the people of Scotland from Robert Burns’ global legacy.
S1M-1506# Robert Burns (lodged on 8 January 2001) Dorothy-Grace Elder*, Mr Kenneth Gibson*, Mr Jamie McGrigor*
S1M-1506# Robert Burns (lodged on 8 January 2001) Tommy Sheridan*, Alex Fergusson*, Phil Gallie*, Mr Keith Harding*, Alex Johnstone*
S1M-1506# Robert Burns (lodged on 8 January 2001) Dr Winnie Ewing*, Mrs Lyndsay McIntosh*, Mr Brian Monteith*, Dr Elaine Murray*

S1M-1506# David Mundell: Robert Burns—That the Parliament recognises the immeasurable contribution which the life and works of Robert Burns have made to the history and culture of Scotland; commends the activities of the Robert Burns World Federation, individual Burns’ Clubs and the many other organisations and individuals who are dedicated to preserving and promoting Burns’ memory and work in Scotland and abroad, and believes that the Scottish Executive should do all it can to ensure that the maximum educational, cultural and economic, particularly from tourism, benefits are gained by the people of Scotland from Robert Burns’ global legacy. Supported by: Dorothy-Grace Elder, Mr Kenneth Gibson, Mr Jamie McGrigor, Tommy Sheridan, Alex Fergusson, Phil Gallie, Mr Keith Harding, Alex Johnstone, Dr Winnie Ewing, Mrs Lyndsay McIntosh, Mr Brian Monteith, Dr Elaine Murray, David McLetchie*, Fiona McLeod*
S1M-1506# Robert Burns (lodged on 8 January 2001) Mr David Davidson*, Andrew Wilson*

S1M-1506# Robert Burns (lodged on 8 January 2001) Fiona Hyslop*, Cathy Jamieson*, Fergus Ewing*, Mary Scanlon*, Linda Fabiani*, Irene McGugan*, Mr Kenny MacAskill*, Tricia Marwick*, Alex Neil*, Bill Aitken*, Kay Ullrich*
S1M-1506# Robert Burns (lodged on 8 January 2001) Mr Jamie Stone*, Michael Russell*, Margaret Jamieson*, Mr Duncan Hamilton*, Cathy Peattie*, John Scott*, Scott Barrie*, Mr Adam Ingram*
S1M-1506# Robert Burns (lodged on 8 January 2001) Mr Gil Paterson*, Nick Johnston*

S1M-1506# David Mundell: Robert Burns—That the Parliament recognises the immeasurable contribution which the life and works of Robert Burns have made to the history and culture of Scotland; commends the activities of the Robert Burns World Federation, individual Burns’ Clubs and the many other organisations and individuals who are dedicated to preserving and promoting Burns’ memory and work in Scotland and abroad, and believes that the Scottish Executive should do all it can to ensure that the maximum educational, cultural and economic, particularly from tourism, benefits are gained by the people of Scotland from Robert Burns’ global legacy. Supported by: Dorothy-Grace Elder, Mr Kenneth Gibson, Mr Jamie McGrigor, Tommy Sheridan, Alex Fergusson, Phil Gallie, Mr Keith Harding, Alex Johnstone, Dr Winnie Ewing, Mrs Lyndsay McIntosh, Mr Brian Monteith, Dr Elaine Murray, Fiona McLeod, David McLetchie, Mr David Davidson, Andrew Wilson, Fiona Hyslop, Cathy Jamieson, Fergus Ewing, Mary Scanlon, Linda Fabiani, Irene McGugan, Mr Kenny MacAskill, Tricia Marwick, Alex Neil, Bill Aitken, Kay Ullrich, Mr Jamie Stone, Michael Russell, Margaret Jamieson, Mr Duncan Hamilton, Cathy Peattie, John Scott, Scott Barrie, Mr Adam Ingram, Mr Gil Paterson, Nick Johnston, Ian Jenkins*
S1M-1506# Robert Burns (lodged on 8 January 2001) Irene Oldfather*, Mrs Margaret Ewing*
S1M-1506# Robert Burns (lodged on 8 January 2001) Robert Brown*, Alasdair Morgan*
